thread.title: Iconic Eaton baseball coach Jim Danley ousted after 45 years, 807 wins
thread.title_full: Iconic Eaton baseball coach Jim Danley ousted after 45 years, 807 wins - The Denver Post

author: Jesse Paul
title: Iconic Eaton baseball coach Jim Danley ousted after 45 years, 807 wins
text:
After 45 years creating a legacy for Eaton's high school, baseball coach Jim Danley's run is officially over.
The small, Eastern Plains town's school board announced its decision on Friday afternoon.
About a month ago, the small town's school district gave Danley a 13-point improvement plan for the upcoming season, saying he needed to sign it or he would be removed as coach.
"After giving Mr. Danley a reasonable opportunity to consider his position regarding the performance improvement place, Mr. Danley did not respond within the communicated deadline," the district said in a statement.
District officials say they are moving forward in a search for a new coach.
Danley, the winningest baseball coach in Colorado history , has said he would not sign the plan, whose stipulations included that his son, Kirk, a longtime volunteer assistant and coach on other Eaton levels, be barred from the program.
The improvement plan, the district says, was prompted by parent complaints.
Danley, whose career record is 807-163-2, has been inducted into multiple halls of fame. Over each of the past 37 years, the Eaton Reds have won either a league, regional or state championship.
